cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.LF, cs.FL. 

The paper deals with the mechanization of coinduction and corecursion in higher-order logic, which is a topic that falls under the area of formal methods and theorem proving. Therefore, cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of Isabelle, which is a popular proof assistant for programming language semantics and verification, suggesting that cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.SE (Software Engineering) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of fixedpoints to express inductive and coinductive data types, which is a topic that falls under the area of formal languages and automata theory, suggesting that cs.LF (Logic in Computer Science) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper illustrates the theory using finite and infinite lists, which is a topic that falls under the area of formal methods and functional programming, suggesting that cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) is another possible sub-category.
